com.dhemery.expressions

Interface TimeFrames

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Eventually

    public interface TimeFrames
extends Eventually
    Factory methods for polling schedules. Each method is named to read like a time frame in a polled expression: 
          assertThat(eventually(), searchField, isDisplayed());
      assertThat(within(1, MINUTES), searchField, isDisplayed());
      assertThat(checkingEvery(1, SECONDS), searchField, isDisplayed());

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default PollingSchedule checkingEvery(Duration interval)
      Creates a polling schedule with the given polling interval and the default polling duration.
      default PollingSchedule checkingEvery(int amount, TemporalUnit unit)
      Creates a polling schedule with the given duration and the default polling interval.
      default PollingSchedule eventually()
      Returns a polling schedule with the default polling interval and duration.
      default Within within(Duration duration)
      Creates a polling schedule with the given duration and the default polling interval.
      default Within within(int amount, TemporalUnit unit)
      Creates a polling schedule with the given duration and the default polling interval.

    • Method Detail

      • eventually

        default PollingSchedule eventually()
        Description copied from interface: Eventually
        Returns a polling schedule with the default polling interval and duration.

        This factory method is named to read nicely in polled expressions: 

              assertThat(eventually(), searchField, isDisplayed());
        The default polling interval and duration are defined by each implementation. Implementors must decide what polling schedule is a reasonable default for their purposes.

        There is no requirement that a new instance be returned each time this method is invoked. If the implementation returns different instances, all instances must be pairwise equal.

        Specified by:
        eventually in interface Eventually
        Returns:
        DefaultPollingSchedule.INSTANCE.
        See Also:
        PollingSchedule.equals(java.lang.Object)

      • within

        default Within within(int amount,
                      TemporalUnit unit)
        Creates a polling schedule with the given duration and the default polling interval.

        This factory method is named to read nicely in polled expressions: 

              assertThat(within(1, MINUTES), searchField, isDisplayed());
        To specify a polling interval, call checkingEvery on the returned schedule: 
        ˜
      assertThat(within(1, MINUTES).checkingEvery(1, SECONDS), searchField, isDisplayed());
        Parameters:
        amount - the duration to poll, measured in terms of the unit
        unit - the unit that the duration is measured in
        Returns:
        a polling schedule with the given duration and the default polling interval
        Implementation Requirements
        the returned schedule must have the same polling interval as the schedules returned by eventually.

      • within

        default Within within(Duration duration)
        Creates a polling schedule with the given duration and the default polling interval.

        This factory method is named to read nicely in polled expressions: 

              Duration oneMinute = Duration.of(1, MINUTES);
      assertThat(within(oneMinute), searchField, isDisplayed());
        To specify a polling interval, call checkingEvery on the returned schedule: 
              assertThat(within(oneMinute).checkingEvery(1, SECONDS), searchField, isDisplayed());
        Parameters:
        duration - the duration to poll
        Returns:
        a polling schedule with the given duration and default interval
        Implementation Requirements
        the returned schedule must have the same polling interval as the schedules returned by eventually.

      • checkingEvery

        default PollingSchedule checkingEvery(int amount,
                                      TemporalUnit unit)
        Creates a polling schedule with the given duration and the default polling interval.

        This factory method is named to read nicely in polled expressions: 

              assertThat(checkingEvery(1, SECONDS), searchField, isDisplayed());
        To specify both a polling interval and duration, see within(int, java.time.temporal.TemporalUnit).
        Parameters:
        amount - the interval on which to poll, measured in terms of the unit
        unit - the unit that the polling interval is measured in
        Returns:
        a polling schedule with the given interval and default polling duration
        Implementation Requirements
        the returned schedule must have the same polling duration as the schedules returned by eventually.

      • checkingEvery

        default PollingSchedule checkingEvery(Duration interval)
        Creates a polling schedule with the given polling interval and the default polling duration.

        This factory method is named to read nicely in polled expressions: 

              Duration oneSecond = Duration.of(1, SECONDS);
      assertThat(checkingEvery(oneSecond), searchField, isDisplayed());
        To specify both a polling interval and duration, see within(int, java.time.temporal.TemporalUnit).
        Parameters:
        interval - the interval on which to poll
        Returns:
        a polling schedule with the given interval and default polling duration
        Implementation Requirements
        the returned schedule must have the same polling duration as the schedules returned by eventually.
